channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Towards a Unified Framework for Bioperations on $e^\star$-Open Sets in Topological Spaces
item.description: arXiv:2412.12554v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we introduce the concept of $e^\star_{[\gamma,\gamma']}$-open sets in topological spaces and examine their properties in detail. Additionally, we propose a new class of functions, termed $(e^\star_{[\gamma,\gamma']},\ e^\star_{[\beta,\beta']})$-continuous functions, and explore their fundamental characteristics.
item.dc:creator: G. Saravanakumar, M. Arun

item.title: On the Gauss map assignment for minimal surfaces and the Osserman curvature estimate
item.description: arXiv:2412.12615v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The Gauss map of a conformal minimal immersion of an open Riemann surface $M$ into $\mathbb{R}^n$, $n\ge 3$, is a holomorphic map $M\to{\bf Q}^{n-2}\subset \mathbb{CP}^{n-1}$. Denote by ${\rm CMI}_{\rm full}(M,\mathbb{R}^n)$ and $\mathscr{O}_{\rm full}(M,{\bf Q}^{n-2})$ the spaces of full conformal minimal immersions $M\to\mathbb{R}^n$ and full holomorphic maps $M\to{\bf Q}^{n-2}$, respectively, endowed with the compact-open topology. In this paper we show that the Gauss map assignment $\mathscr{G}:{\rm CMI}_{\rm full}(M,\mathbb{R}^n)\to \mathscr{O}_{\rm full}(M,{\bf Q}^{n-2})$, taking a full conformal minimal immersion to its Gauss map, is an open map. This implies, in view of a result of Forstneric and the authors, that $\mathscr{G}$ is a quotient map. The same results hold for the map $(\mathscr{G},Flux):{\rm CMI}_{\rm full}(M,\mathbb{R}^n)\to \mathscr{O}_{\rm full}(M,{\bf Q}^{n-2})\times H^1(M,\mathbb{R}^n)$, where $Flux:{\rm CMI}_{\rm full}(M,\mathbb{R}^n)\to H^1(M,\mathbb{R}^n)$ is the flux assignment. As application, we establish that the set of maps $G\in \mathscr{O}_{\rm full}(M,{\bf Q}^{n-2})$ such that the family $\mathscr{G}^{-1}(G)$ of all minimal surfaces in $\mathbb{R}^n$ with the Gauss map $G$ satisfies the classical Osserman curvature estimate, is meagre in the space of holomorphic maps $M\to {\bf Q}^{n-2}$.
item.dc:creator: Antonio Alarcon, Francisco J. Lopez

item.title: Dynamical Systems On Generalised Klein Bottles
item.description: arXiv:2411.06215v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We propose a high dimensional generalisation of the standard Klein bottle, going beyond those considered previously. We address the problem of generating continuous scalar fields (distributions) and dynamical systems (flows) on such state spaces, which can provide a rich source of examples for future investigations. We consider a class of high dimensional dynamical systems that model distributed information processing within the human cortex, which may be capable of exhibiting some Klein bottle symmetries. We deploy topological data analytic methods in order to analyse their resulting dynamical behaviour, and suggesting future challenges.
item.dc:creator: Peter Grindrod, Ka Man Yim
